section.title: Arc Length
section.p: In we used the radius of a circle, r, and an angle, \theta to define polar coordinates. In this section, we use these variables to find the length of arcs on circles.

assemblage.p: An arcarc is a portion of the circumference of a circle.
Arc lengthArc length is defined as the length of an arc, s, along a circle of radius r subtended (drawn out) by an angle \theta.
The length of the arc around an entire circle is called the circumferencecircumference of the circle. The circumference of a circle is C=2\pi r

section.p: Recall from that we defined radians as an angle measurement that arises by looking at angles as a fraction of the unit circle. Since the radius of the unit circle is 1, the circumference of the unit circle is 2\pi. This is why there are 2\pi radians in one complete trip around a circle. Thus, arc lengths on the unit circle correspond to the angle measures (in radians) that those arcs subtend.
